TEXT.TITLE: BONN MINISTRY HAS NO COMMENT ON BAKER REMARKS
TEXT.BODY: The West German Finance Ministry declined to comment on weekend criticism by U.S. Treasury Secretary James Baker of recent West German interest rate increases. Baker said the U.S. Would re-examine the February Louvre Accord to stabilise currencies reached by leading industrial democracies. The rise in West Germany short term interest rates was not in the spirit of an agreement by these nations in Washington, which reaffirmed the Louvre pact, he said. A Finance Ministry spokesman, asked for an official ministry reaction to Baker's remarks, said he could make no comment. REUTER
